member.name: T:ModbusTCP.Master
member.summary:
Modbus TCP common driver class. This class implements a modbus TCP master driver. It supports the following commands:
Read coils Read discrete inputs Write single coil Write multiple cooils Read holding register Read input register Write single register Write multiple register
All commands can be sent in synchronous or asynchronous mode. If a value is accessed in synchronous mode the program will stop and wait for slave to response. If the slave didn't answer within a specified time a timeout exception is called. The class uses multi threading for both synchronous and asynchronous access. For the communication two lines are created. This is necessary because the synchronous thread has to wait for a previous command to finish.

member.summary: Create master instance without parameters.

member.summary: Create master instance with parameters.
member.param: IP adress of modbus slave.
Port number of modbus slave. Usually port 502 is used.

member.summary: Start connection to slave.
member.param: IP adress of modbus slave.
Port number of modbus slave. Usually port 502 is used.

member.summary: Stop connection to slave.

member.name: M:ModbusTCP.Master.ReadCoils(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Read coils from slave asynchronous. The result is given in the response function.
member.param: Unique id that marks the transaction. In asynchonous mode this id is given to the callback function.
Address from where the data read begins.
Length of data.

Length of data.

member.name: M:ModbusTCP.Master.WriteSingleCoils(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Write single coil in slave asynchronous. The result is given in the response function.
member.param: Unique id that marks the transaction. In asynchonous mode this id is given to the callback function.
Address from where the data read begins.
Specifys if the coil should be switched on or off.

member.summary: Write single coil in slave synchronous.
member.param: Unique id that marks the transaction. In asynchonous mode this id is given to the callback function.
Address from where the data read begins.
Specifys if the coil should be switched on or off.
Contains the result of the synchronous write.

member.name: E:ModbusTCP.Master.OnResponseData
member.summary: Response data event. This event is called when new data arrives

member.name: E:ModbusTCP.Master.OnException
member.summary: Exception data event. This event is called when the data is incorrect

member.name: P:ModbusTCP.Master.timeout
member.summary: Response timeout. If the slave didn't answers within in this time an exception is called.

member.name: P:ModbusTCP.Master.refresh
member.summary: Refresh timer for slave answer. The class is polling for answer every X ms.

member.name: P:ModbusTCP.Master.connected
member.summary: Shows if a connection is active.

member.name: T:ModbusTCP.Master.ResponseData
member.summary: Response data event. This event is called when new data arrives

member.name: T:ModbusTCP.Master.ExceptionData
member.summary: Exception data event. This event is called when the data is incorrect
